The Mannheimer Swartling Training Programme is for those wishing to complement their law studies with practical exercises and fictional cases. Participants spend a number of days developing their legal skills, making new contacts and familiarising themselves with the work of a business law firm.

Whatever your choice of future career, the Training Programme is a valuable experience. During the three sessions of the programme you will have the opportunity to develop your skills in areas such as negotiating techniques, legal English, project management and rhetoric. You will work with other participants on realistic cases under the guidance of the firm’s lawyers.

Practical information

The Mannheimer Swartling Training Programme is intended for students in terms three to six of the law degree programme. The Training Programme starts in March 2025, and concludes with a diploma later in the spring. The course is held in Stockholm, but participants from all Swedish universities are of course welcome. Where applicable, the firm will pay the cost of travel and hotel accommodation.

Applications

The application for next year’s programme opens on January 1, 2026. You can find the information under Vacancies. Attach your CV, cover letter and your grades from the law degree programme. Please note that the number of places is limited.
